meanings.definition: Having a margin with low, rounded or scalloped projections.
meanings.sent1: The crenate leaves of the plant were easy to spot.
meanings.sent2: The baker made a crenate design on the pie crust.
meanings.sent3: The crenate edge of the paper made it look like a fancy doily.
meanings.sent4: The crenate clouds in the sky resembled fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent5: The crenate pattern on the fabric added a touch of elegance.

meanings.definition: To form a margin with low, rounded or scalloped projections.
meanings.sent1: She carefully crenated the edges of the paper with scissors.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to crenate the border of the painting for a unique look.
meanings.sent3: The chef crenated the pastry crust to make it visually appealing.
meanings.sent4: The waves crenated the sandy shore like a delicate lace.
meanings.sent5: The tailor crenated the hem of the dress to give it a decorative finish.
